Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: Approximately twelve feet by twelve feet, this stall provides a comfortable, yet compact home for livestock. The pine walls enclosing the space are six feet in height and painted a deep shade of hunter green. A double-hung door in a contrasting warm cream hue occupies much of the northern wall, flanked on either side by a hitching posts to which an animal can be better secured. In the southern wall is a small, single-pane window that lights the area during the daytime hours. A pair of troughs, one filled with cool, clean water and the other filled with oats, stands beneath the window. Hay is strewn about the dark red stone floor and piled high in the southwestern corner, both for idle munching and for soft bedding.

Approximately twelve feet by twelve feet, this stall provides a comfortable, yet compact home for livestock. The pine walls enclosing the space are six feet in height and painted a deep shade of hunter green. A double-hung door in a contrasting warm cream hue occupies much of the northern wall, flanked on either side by a hitching posts to which an animal can be better secured. In the southern wall is a small, single-pane window that lights the area during the daytime hours. A pair of troughs, one filled with cool, clean water and the other filled with oats, stands beneath the window. Hay is strewn about the dark red stone floor and piled high in the southwestern corner, both for idle munching and for soft bedding.

Approximately twelve feet by twelve feet, this stall provides a comfortable, yet compact home for livestock. The pine walls enclosing the space are six feet in height and painted a deep shade of hunter green. A double-hung door in a contrasting warm cream hue occupies much of the northern wall, flanked on either side by a hitching posts to which an animal can be better secured. In the southern wall is a small, single-pane window that lights the area during the daytime hours. A pair of troughs, one filled with cool, clean water and the other filled with oats, stands beneath the window. Hay is strewn about the dark red stone floor and piled high in the southwestern corner, both for idle munching and for soft bedding.
a double-hung stall door leading north
Crafted from pine and painted a warm cream hue, the double-hung door leading to the north features upper and lower panels which can be opened separately. $(parent-desc)
Hay has been piled high in the southwestern corner of the stall.

Six feet in height and twelve feet in width, the north wall of this stall is crafted from planks of pine sanded smooth and painted a deep shade of hunter green. Aligned horizontally, the planks are affixed on either end to a matching support beam which extends up to the high ceiling above. A double-hung door painted a warm cream hue occupies most of this half-height wall.

Six feet in height and twelve feet in width, the north wall of this stall is crafted from planks of pine sanded smooth and painted a deep shade of hunter green. Aligned horizontally, the planks are affixed on either end to a matching support beam which extends up to the high ceiling above. A double-hung door painted a warm cream hue occupies most of this half-height wall.

Six feet in height and twelve feet in width, the south wall of this stall butts up against the exterior wall of the building. It is crafted from planks of pine sanded smooth and painted a deep shade of hunter green. Aligned horizontally, the planks are affixed on either end to a matching support beam which extends up to the high ceiling above. Two additional planks in a contrasting cream color are fastened crossways to the surface to reinforce the half-height wall. A small, dusty window has been set into this surface just above the cross point of the cream-colored reinforcement beams.

Six feet in height and twelve feet in width, the south wall of this stall butts up against the exterior wall of the building. It is crafted from planks of pine sanded smooth and painted a deep shade of hunter green. Aligned horizontally, the planks are affixed on either end to a matching support beam which extends up to the high ceiling above. Two additional planks in a contrasting cream color are fastened crossways to the surface to reinforce the half-height wall. A small, dusty window has been set into this surface just above the cross point of the cream-colored reinforcement beams.
